New Records: Payton Pritchard moved Pritchard ahead of Avery Bradley for ninth place in all time three-pointers made in Celtics history
Key Match Events: Indiana made 16 of its first 18 points in the paint
Boston struggled early to contain Indy's perimeter players
Jaylen Brown scored back-to-back and-1s for a quick six points to cut the Pacers lead to three (76-73) with 8:19 remaining
Jayson Tatum blocked Myles Turner at the rim which led to a Derrick White layup to make it 89-83 leading to a Pacers timeout
Indiana went on a 13-0 run to seal the game
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics will look to bounce back on New Year’s Eve when they take on the Toronto Raptors at 3 p.m.
Mazzulla after loss to Kings: ‘it’s not a long-term effort thing’
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana scored 66 points in the paint
The Pacers shot 58.1% from the floor and 35.7% from three, compared to Boston’s 52.4% from the field and 37% from beyond the arc
Boston allowed Indiana to score 36 of their 65 points in the paint
The fourth quarter was sloppy for both teams as the Pacers and Celtics kept giving away the ball with unenforced turnovers
Others: Andrew Nembhard had 14 points after missing the previous game
Tyrese Haliburton hurt the C’s all night finishing with 31 points, but it was his ability to get into the paint at ease and either making a shot or finding a teammate
